Provided By:: New Mexico State University - College of Arts and Sciences
title: Anayis Generalized Reciprocity Current Use Scholarship
Fields of Study:: Astronomy, Chemistry, Biochemistry, Computer Sciences, Geological Sciences, Math, Physics
Description:: The Anayis Generalized Reciprocity Current Use  Scholarship is available to junior and senior students at New Mexico State University.  You must be majoring in astronomy, chemistry, biochemistry, computer science, geology, math or physics and have a minimum 2.4 GPA to be eligible for this award.  U.S. citizenship and financial need are also required.

Provided By:: New Mexico State University - College of Arts and Sciences
title: Charles E. Stillwell Memorial Endowed Scholarship
Description:: The Charles E. Stillwell Memorial Endowed Scholarship is available to sophomore students at New Mexico State University.  You must have a minimum 2.7 GPA and submit a short essay to be eligible for this award.

Provided By:: New Mexico State University - College of Arts and Sciences
title: John E. and Grace E. and John L. Gill Memorial Scholarship
Description:: The John E. and Grace E. and John L. Gill Memorial Scholarship is available to undergraduate students at New Mexico State University.  You must be a resident of New Mexico and demonstrate financial need  to be eligible for this award.  Preference is give to graduates of Las Cruces High School and those pursing a degree related to a medical field.

Provided By:: New Mexico State University - College of Arts and Sciences
title: S.J. Scheidegger Burke Endowed Scholarship
Fields of Study:: Astronomy, Chemistry, Biochemistry, Computer Sciences, Geological Sciences, Math, Physics
Description:: The S.J. Scheidegger Burke Endowed Scholarship is available to sophomore, junior and senior students at New Mexico State University.  You must be majoring in biology, chemistry, biochemistry, computer science, math or physics and have a minimum 3.2 GPA to be eligible for this award.  You must also be a single parent, a resident of New Mexico and demonstrate financial need to be considered for this award.

Provided By:: New Mexico State University - College of Arts and Sciences
title: Ralph W. Dressel Memorial Endowed Scholarship
Description:: The Ralph W. Dressel Memorial Endowed Scholarship is available to sophomore, junior and senior students at New Mexico State University.  You must have a minimum GPA of 3.0 and complete three essay questions in order to be considered for this award.

Provided By:: New Mexico State University - College of Arts and Sciences
title: David and Reta Warren Endowed Scholarship
Description:: The David and Reta Warren Endowed Scholarship is available to students with at least 90 undergraduate credit hours at New Mexico State University.  You must be entering dental school, have a minimum GPA of 3.5 and have been a member of the NMSU Pre-Dental society for at least one year in order to be considered for this award.  Preference is given to graduates of New Mexico high schools.

title: Dean's Academic Merit Scholarship - Saint Martin's University
Description:: The Dean's Academic Merit Scholarship is available to entering freshmen at Saint Martin's University.  To be considered for this award, you must have a GPA average of 3.3.

title: Resume Genius Scholarship
Description:: The Resume Genius Scholarship is available to students enrolled at an accredited college or university.  You must create a resume based on the life of any fictional or non-fictional character, from TV, history, literature or myth to qualify for this award.

title: Internet Marketing Scholarship
Description:: The Internet Marketing Scholarship is available to students enrolled at an accredited college or university.  You must have completed at least one year of college and have a minimum 3.0 GPA to qualify for this award.  Additionally, you must demonstrate a passion for internet marketing.

title: Car Accident Injury Survivor Scholarship
Description:: The Car Accident Injury Survivor Scholarship is available to students enrolled at an accredited college or university.  You must have a minimum 2.75 GPA and have sustained injuries from an auto accident at some point in your life to qualify for this award.  Additionally, you must submit a copy of the police report or have proof of your accident and submit a maximum three page essay describing your accident.

title: Wittenburg University Scholar Award
Description:: The Wittenburg University Scholar Award is available to entering freshmen at Wittenberg University.  You must demonstrate academic achievement to be considered for this award.

title: Wittenberg Honor Award
Description:: The Honor Award is available to entering freshmen at Wittenberg University.  You must demonstrate good citizenship and involvement in co - curricular activities to be considered for this award.

title: Love Your Career Scholarship
Description:: The Love Your Career Scholarship is available to students attending an accredited college or university.  You must submit a 500 to 1000 word essay describing at least 3 steps that you plan to take in the next year to start a path towards having a career that you love in order to qualify for this award. What are your passions that could be turned into a career? What are some ideas you have for a business based on things that you love and are skilled at?

title: Armenian American Medical Society Scholarship
Fields of Study:: Medical, Pharmacy, Dental, Nursing, Health Profession Fields
Description:: The Armenian American Medical Society Scholarship is available to students who are of Armenian descent, or have a special interest in Armenian medical causes.  You must be enrolled in a medical, pharmacy, dental, physician's assistant, nursing, or other health profession program and have demonstrated community service in order to qualify for this award.

title: I Define Success Scholarship
Description:: The I Define Success Scholarship is available to undergraduate students.  To be considered, you must submit a minimum 300 - word essay describing how you define success, and your plans to be successful.

title: The Fountain Essay Contest
Description:: The Fountain Essay Contest is available to students of all ages.  You must submit a 1500-2500 word essay on the current issues facing today's immigrants.  Submissions should be  factual, but with an inspirational style that will feed both your reason and soul.

title: Chancellor Scholarship - WSSU
Description:: The Chancellor Scholarship is available to entering freshmen at Winston-Salem State University.  You must have an outstanding academic record and be committed to building better communities to be eligible for this award.

title: Better America Scholarship Program
Description:: The Better America Scholarship Program is available to students currently enrolled at an accredited university or college.  You must submit an essay in 200 words or less describing how you intend to change America in order to qualify for this award.

title: Presidential Scholarship
Description:: The Presidential Scholarship is available to entering freshmen at Worcester Polytechnic Institute.  You must demonstrate high academic performance in high school and standardized test scores or Flex Path submission to be considered for this award.

title: Foisie Scholars Program
Description:: The Foisie Scholars Program is available to undergraduate students at Worcester Polytechnic Institute.  You must demonstrate high academic performance in high school and standardized test scores or Flex Path submission to be eligible for this award.

title: UPS Scholarship
Description:: The UPS Scholarship is available to new or continuing students at Triton College.  You must have a minimum GPA of 2.0 to be eligible for this award.  Essay question to be answered: What do you believe to be the greatest barrier(s) to completing a college degree, or reaching one's educational goals, and suggest a solution(s) for addressing these barriers? Describe your plan to ensure you accomplish your educational and career goals. Be sure to include your long- and short-term goals and why you are pursuing higher education.

title: Classified Association Kathy Roman Memorial Scholarship
Description:: The Classified Association Kathy Roman Memorial Scholarship is available to new or continuing students at Triton College.  You must have a minimum GPA of 2.75 GPA, U.S. Citizen and Illinois resident to be eligible for this award.

title: Pepsi Cola Scholarship
Description:: The Pepsi Cola Scholarship is available to students who have completed at least 12 credit hours at Triton College.  You must have a minimum GPA of 2.0 and enrolled in at least nine credit hours to be eligible for this award.  Essay question to be answered: What do you believe is the greatest barrier(s) to completing a college degree or reaching one's educational goals, and what are your suggestions for a solution(s) for addressing these barriers? Describe your plan to ensure you accomplish your educational and career goals. Be sure to include your long- and short-term goals and why you are pursuing higher education.

title: Trustee Honors Scholarship
Description:: The Trustee Honors Scholarship is available to high school seniors who are enrolled in at least 12 credit hours per semester at Triton College.  You must rank in the top 10 percent of your graduation class or have a minimum GPA of 3.35 at the end of the seventh semester, or an ACT score of 25 or higher to be eligible for this award.

title: Biancalana Family Scholarship
Description:: The Biancalana Family Scholarship is available to full-time students at Triton College.  You must have a minimum GPA of 3.5 and completed at least one semester of the hospitality program to be eligible for this award.

title: Cancer Federation Scholarship
Description:: The Cancer Federation Scholarship is available to full-time or part-time students at Triton College.  You must have a minimum GPA of 3.0 and a degree-seeking student in a health-related field to be eligible for this award.
